sentences.en: Are such " passive intervening landowners " liable under section 107 ( a )?
sentences.cn: 那么根据第107条 ( a ),那样 “ 被动的介入其间的土地拥有者 ” 是否也负有责任 呢 ?

sentences.en: Blind children tend to be more passive in this area of motor development than sighted children.
sentences.cn: 失明的孩子在动作发展的这一方面往往比不失明的孩子更加被动。

sentences.en: He has a passive expression on his face.
sentences.cn: 他脸上有一种漠然的表情.

sentences.en: He played a passive role in the relationship.
sentences.cn: 他在他们的关系中处于被动地位。

sentences.en: His passive attitude made things easier for me.
sentences.cn: 他顺从的态度让我做起事来要轻松些。

sentences.en: In spite of my efforts the boy remained passive.
sentences.cn: 尽管我努力,那男孩还是不起劲.

sentences.en: It lands the manager in a passive position.
sentences.cn: 它使经理处于被动地位.

sentences.en: It's a sad truth that children are the biggest victims of passive smoking.
sentences.cn: 不幸的事实是，儿童是被动吸烟的最大受害者。

sentences.en: Kathy seems to take a very passive role in the relationship.
sentences.cn: 凯茜在这一关系中似乎扮演着十分被动的角色。

sentences.en: Passive smoking can be deadly too.
sentences.cn: 被动吸烟也可能会致命。

sentences.en: Passive smoking can be hazardous to health.
The active became the passive, whether the men liked it or not.
sentences.cn: 主动态变成了被动态, 不管人们愿意不愿意.

sentences.en: The enemy were thus reduced to a passive position in which they found it hard to give up the battle and yet had to give it up.
sentences.cn: 敌人于是就陷入了欲罢不能,而又不得不罢的被动地位.

sentences.en: The normal word order is reversed in passive sentences.
sentences.cn: 正常词序在被动句中是颠倒的。

sentences.en: their passive acceptance of their fate
sentences.cn: 他们对命运的消极接受

sentences.en: We should translate this sentence in passive voice.
sentences.cn: 我们应该用被动语态翻译这个句子.

words.tran_cn: 被动性；被动结构；无抵抗

phrases.tran_cn: 不活动大陆边缘，被动大陆边缘
被动收入，被动收益；消极收益
无源传感器，被动式传感器

trans.tran_cn: 消极的，被动的，被动语态的
trans.tran_en: someone who is passive tends to accept things that happen to them or things that people say to them, without taking any action
the passive form of a verb, for example ‘was destroyed’ in the sentence ‘The building was destroyed during the war.’
